717611f-b.text:
(1)
The Lincoln Square Arcade and Loew's Lincoln Square Theatre, after the disastrous fire which gutted the building, Broadway, west side, from 66th Street to, but not including, 67th Street. This was the first fire in the history of New York which called out every available piece of fire fighting apparatus. The building and theatre were later rebuilt to conform with their original
appearance.
January 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing the entrance to the theatre.
January 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, a closer view of the entrance to the theatre.
January 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
